title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #956: Unit Distances Between Convex Translates**

Let h(n) = max unit distances among n disjoint convex translates.

**Status**: OPEN

**Conjecture**: h(n) > n^(1+c) for some c > 0.

title: Set Distance
content:
**setDistance C D**: δ(C, D) = inf{dist(c, d) : c ∈ C, d ∈ D}.

The minimum distance between any two points in the sets.

title: Distance Symmetry
content:
**setDistance_symm**: δ(C, D) = δ(D, C).

Set distance is symmetric.

title: Distance Non-negative
content:
**setDistance_nonneg**: δ(C, D) ≥ 0.

Set distance is always non-negative.

title: Compact Convex Set
content:
**CompactConvex**: A structure with:
- carrier: the set in ℝ²
- convex: the set is convex
- compact: the set is compact
- nonempty: the set is nonempty

title: Translate
content:
**translate C x**: C +ₛ x = {c + x : c ∈ C}.

The translation of set C by vector x.

title: Translate Properties
content:
**translate_convex, translate_compact**: Translates preserve convexity and compactness.

These are essential for the problem setup.

title: Disjoint Translates
content:
**DisjointTranslates n**: A configuration with:
- base: a CompactConvex set
- centers: n points in ℝ²
- disjoint: all translates are pairwise disjoint

title: Has Unit Distance
content:
**HasUnitDistance config i j**: δ(C + xᵢ, C + xⱼ) = 1.

Two translates are at unit distance apart.

title: Unit Distance Count
content:
**unitDistanceCount config**: Number of pairs at unit distance.

Counts unordered pairs (i, j) with i < j and unit distance.

title: Function h(n)
content:
**h n**: Maximum unit distances among n disjoint translates.

The extremal function of the problem.

title: Monotonicity
content:
**h_mono**: h(n) ≤ h(m) for n ≤ m.

**h_nonneg**: h(n) ≥ 0.

title: Point Unit Distance Function
content:
**unitDistancePoints n**: f(n) = max unit distances among n points in ℝ².

The classical unit distance function.

title: h ≥ f
content:
**h_ge_f**: h(n) ≥ f(n).

Convex translates can achieve at least as many unit distances as points.

(Use small disks centered at the points.)

title: f(n) Bounds
content:
**f_upper_bound**: f(n) ≤ n^(4/3) (Spencer-Szemerédi-Trotter).

**f_lower_bound**: f(n) ≥ n^(1+c/2) for some c > 0.

title: Erdős-Pach Upper Bound
content:
**erdos_pach_upper_bound (1990)**: h(n) ≤ 2n^(4/3).

The best known upper bound for convex translates.

title: General Convex Sets
content:
**DisjointConvexSets n**: n disjoint convex sets (not necessarily translates).

**h_general n**: Max unit distances for general convex sets.

title: General Convex Bound
content:
**erdos_pach_general**: h_general(n) ≤ 2n^(7/5).

**h_le_h_general**: h(n) ≤ h_general(n).

**general_exponent_larger**: 7/5 > 4/3.

title: The Conjecture
content:
**ErdosPachConjecture**: ∃ c > 0, ∀ n ≥ 10, h(n) > n^(1+c).

**SuperlinearConjecture**: h(n) grows faster than linear.

The main open question.

title: Conjecture from f
content:
**conjecture_from_f**: If f(n) > n^(1+c), then the Erdős-Pach conjecture holds.

Since h(n) ≥ f(n).

title: Constructions
content:
**lattice_construction**: Lattices give ≥ n-1 unit distances.

**grid_construction**: Grids give Ω(n log n / log log n) unit distances.

These are the best known lower bounds.

title: Incidence Geometry
content:
**szemeredi_trotter**: The famous point-line incidence bound.

**upper_bound_uses_incidences**: The h(n) upper bound uses Szemerédi-Trotter.

title: Special Cases
content:
**disk_case**: For disks, unit distances bounded by f(n) + n.

**segment_case**: Line segments can achieve 2(n-1) unit distances.

Different shapes may have different behavior.

title: Main Result
content:
**erdos_956_bounds**: Summary of known bounds.

Ω(n log n / log log n) ≤ h(n) ≤ O(n^(4/3))

The conjecture h(n) > n^(1+c) remains OPEN.

title: Problem Status
content:
**erdos_956_answer**: "OPEN: Is h(n) > n^(1+c) for some c > 0?"

**erdos_956_status**: "OPEN - Erdős-Pach conjecture unresolved"

**bounds_gap**: The upper bound n^(4/3) exceeds the lower bound n log n / log log n.
